attributes.additional_details:
I, along with millions of other people give the BBC £150 a year to provide me and those other people with entertainment.

BBC3 is a huge part of this.

As a TV license payer, I think I should have some input into how my money is being spent, especially when I have no choice to pay it, if i want to legally watch television.

Admittedly, I do use BBC1 and BBC2 for approximately 1-2 hours a week (which i could live without), and I never use iPlayer or any BBC radio stations.

This means, If they scrap BBC3, I'm going to have to pay £150/year for a services that I don't use, or want.

Please stop the BBC from moving BBC3 to iPlayer and keep it on the TV.

Alternitavely, I would much rather pay an extra 50p a year (along with everyone else) to make up for the £100m that the BBC need to save.

Thank you.

rejection.details: This is an operational matter for the BBC.
